tasks.task: Extract all relevant topics for this content.
Take a deep breath and carefully review the information provided in the system prompt and this prompt.
Examine the given page, identifying all textual elements as defined in the XML tags.
Determine the primary reading direction and any additional languages present on the page.

For each identified text element: Assign a unique sequential ID (elem_001, elem_002, elem_003, etc.). Determine its type (e.g., h1, h2, paragraph, header, footer, sidebar, figure, footnote, caption). Assign an order number reflecting its position in the logical reading sequence. Extract the full text content of the element. For footnotes and captions, set the ref attribute to the ID of the element they reference. For figures, include both caption (visible text) and alt_text (description of visual content).
Pay special attention to the layout of the page, including columns, sidebars, and any non-standard text arrangements.

Determine heading hierarchy: Identify the main title or most prominent heading as h1. Identify major section headings as h2. Identify subsection headings as h3 or h4. Use visual prominence (size, weight, spacing) to determine hierarchy.
Ensure that footnotes, captions, and other supplementary text are extracted in a logical order relative to their references in the main text.
For complex layouts, mentally map out the reading flow before beginning the extraction process.
If you encounter unusual text arrangements or are unsure of the correct reading order, refer to the guidance in the XML tags.

Organize your extracted text according to the structure provided in the XML tags, ensuring that: Every element has a unique id attribute. Every element has an order attribute reflecting reading sequence. Order numbers are sequential with no gaps (1, 2, 3, not 1, 3, 5). Cross-references use the ref attribute where applicable.
Review your extracted text to ensure completeness, accuracy, and proper ordering, checking that you've captured all textual content from the page.
Take a final deep breath and ensure your extraction is thorough, follows all provided guidelines, and accurately represents the full textual content of the page in its original reading order.
